projects.title: General Info
projects.description: As a software developer at Hagee Ministries, I update and maintain 8 different websites. These sites are used for collecting donations across the globe as well as eCommerce stores, schools, and other organizations controlled by Hagee Ministries. We recently ported all sites from .NET Framework to .NET Core 2.2. For 6 of our sites which are similar in functionality and design, like sa-ccs.org, we utilize a component architecture which allows us to work on a unified codebase for sites.

projects.title: JHM.org Port
projects.description: I assisted in moving the jhm.org website from .NET Framework to .NET Core 2.2. We also moved a large portion of the sites functionality to shared services and shared controllers, to benefit other Hagee Ministries websites like sacornerstone.org. I redesigned and merged administrative tools for jhm.org and our customer service software to create a more unified codebase.

projects.title: Component Sites
projects.description: I maintain and update Razor views and .NET Core controllers which are shared across 6 different sites associated with Hagee Ministries. I am currently aiding in moving the front-end for our component sites to React, to aid in porting all sites to mobile web apps in the future. One of our biggest component sites is sa-ccs.org.

projects.title: General Info
projects.description: As a software developer at Airstrip Technologies, I built dashboards to handle large datasets as well as internal tools for installation engineers.  I utilized React, ExpressJS, and Microsoft SQL to build new websites and tools to supplement Airstrip's existing products.

projects.title: ECG Tool
projects.description: I worked as the frontend developer for a new Electrocardiography dashboard. The ECG dashboard displays several hundred ECG notifications in realtime, to aid hospital administrators in consistently delivering treatment as fast as possible.  Since the dashboard had to handle a large amount of graphics and timers, I focused on leveraging React to only re-render the absolute minimum to keep the latency of the dashboard under a second when under a high load.

projects.title: Cardio Tool
projects.description: The cardio review tool is intended to collect professional feedback from doctors, to better tune our algorithmic tools used to place Pqrst metrics on cardiac wave samples. I built a tool which allowed doctors to review our tools assessment of ECG data, and make adjustments as needed. I used Express, and MS SQL to build a login and other REST endpoints to deliver and capture data. On the frontend, I used React to build interactive graphs.

projects.title: General Info
projects.description: As an engineering intern at Booz Allen, I worked on a wide range of projects.  I updated mobile apps which suffered from deprecated features for both iOS and Android as well as testing VR simulations. Also,  I helped assemble VR Kits for clients.
tools: Objective-C, Java, Unity3D, C#, HTC Vive

projects.title: Mobile App Updates
projects.description: Booz Allen maintains several training apps for different clients. The apps were developed with Unity. I upgraded some features like SMS notifications to Push notifications. The apps also needed minor updates to be able to build for modern versions of iOS and Android.

projects.title: VR Simulation Testing
projects.description: I assisted in testing different VR simulations utilizing the HTC Vive VR Headset. I assured all simulations functioned properly and did not suffer performance stuttering.

projects.title: VR Kits
projects.description: I assembled VR Kits for clients. The kits contained all the necessary equipment needed to use our software. As part of the assembly, VR equipment was tested and the client laptop was loaded and prepared for delivery.

projects.title: Kids Break Ground Mobile App
projects.description: As part of my internship, I finished an MVP version of the application and then ported the app from React Native to Unity, for future improvements. I used Firebase for user logins and to store game data. I developed a framework for flashcard minigames. I improved the avatar customization for the user profiles.

projects.title: General Info
projects.description: As an intern at RSM Marketing, I spent half the week performing marketing work for RSM Marketing while the other half was spent working on E2E Wichita's website in preparation for their first business accelerator.

projects.title: E2E Wichita Website
projects.description: I created an internal forum which mentors and participates utilized during and after the E2E business accelerator. I updated the WordPress site to be more responsive and conform with the rest of E2E's branding.

projects.title: Copywriting
projects.description: I wrote copy for 12 different clients which spanned across Instagram, Facebook, and Twitter. I also scheduled post and monitored social accounts and messages from customers. I also wrote blogs for 3 different clients in the manufacturing and constructing industries.

title: Bachelor's of Fine Arts - Game Design

projects.title: General Info
projects.description: As an undergraduate at NYU's Game Center, I learned not only how to develop games, but how to manage scope and expectations.  The game program exposed me to all aspects of games including design, programming, art, and audio. I focused on programming and build procedurally generated games.
tools: Unity3D, Game Design, Game Development, Git, C#, Maya, Photoshop

projects.title: Gelato Banditos
projects.description: For my action games and intermediate game programming classes, I worked on an open-world, space-flight game. Gelato Banditos originally was an infinite asteroid field with some space combat. After finishing a tech demo, I decided to change the scope to fit my technical skillset and to improve the fun-ness of the game. I learned how to generate large amounts of 3D models and basic enemy AI. The original demo can be foudn on itch: Gelato Banditos

projects.title: Up Next
projects.description: As a programmer in a team of 4, I worked on spawning mechanics for an Arena Shooter game. Up Next was developed as part of a group project for Intermediate Game Development and the final project can be found on itch: Up Next

projects.title: Pumping in the Bathroom
projects.description: Pumping in the bathroom was the first game I worked on using Unity3D. For my introduction to game develop class final, we were asked to make a game that represented our lives in some way. As a type 1 diabetic, I decided to make a game about how annoying small things which only diabetics would understand. This project acted as a big lesson on scoping. In the end, I was able to complete one small scene where players simply have to navigate through a menu as quickly as possible while dodging bystanders.

projects.title: General Info
projects.description: As a student at Wichita State University, I studied marketing, entrepreneurship, and economics. I was a member of Barton Internship Group which took on projects from the Wichita community to allow students to work on real-world projects alongside professionals.

projects.title: Wichita Indochinese Center
projects.description: For my promotional management class, I worked with one other student to develop a marketing plan for the Wichita Indochinese Center. The center is a nonprofit organization which teaches English as a Second language classes. Our proposal centered around getting the message out to children of non-english speakers since the children often have stronger English skills than the parents.
